newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt to give Palestinians $10 mln in aid.
newsitem.headline: Egypt to give Palestinians $10 mln in aid.

text.p: Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak ordered the government to give the Palestinian Authority $10 million in aid to cover needs until an Israeli freeze on its funds was lifted, state media said on Tuesday.
"President Hosni Mubarak ordered the Egyptian government to immediately transfer $10 million to the Palestinian Authority to cover basic needs," state television said.
The Egyptian aid would help cover the needs of the Palestinian people "until the embargo, which the Israeli government has imposed on funds due to the Palestinian Authority, is lifted".

Israel clamped a security closure on the West Bank and Gaza Strip and froze millions of dollars in tax and customs transfers it owes the Palestinian Authority under a 1994 economic protocol after two suicide bombers killed 14 people when they blew themselves up in Jerusalem on July 30.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Monday he decided to release about 30 percent of money, citing partial cooperation by the Palestinian Authority in investigating the bombings.
